item.value: English is the second most spoken language in the world.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876.
The Sputnik 1, launched on October 4, 1957 by Russia, was the first human-made object to orbit the Earth.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
Gravity keeps Earth and the other planets in our solar system in orbit around the Sun. It also keeps the Moon in orbit around Earth.
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is young in comparison, it is only 4.6 billion years old.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
On April 30, 1789, George Washington became the first President of the United States.
The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
Most people blink about 17,000 times a day.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. It can run at 112 kilometres per hour (70 mph). The average person can run from 12 - 17 miles an hour in sprints, so keep away from cheetahs.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
Electric eels can stun both predators and prey with electric shocks of around 500 volts.
The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.

Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876. By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billions land lines in the world. China had more than 350 million phones, more than any other country.
